verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:1
verse.Greek: Παῦλος ἀπόστολος Χριστοῦ Ἰησοῦ διὰ θελήματος Θεοῦ κατ᾽ ἐπαγγελίαν ζωῆς τῆς ἐν Χριστῷ Ἰησοῦ
verse.ULB: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, according to the promise of the life that is in Christ Jesus,
verse.residue: , an of through the , according to the of the that is ,

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:2
verse.Greek: Τιμοθέῳ ἀγαπητῷ τέκνῳ Χάρις ἔλεος εἰρήνη ἀπὸ Θεοῦ Πατρὸς καὶ Χριστοῦ Ἰησοῦ τοῦ Κυρίου ἡμῶν
verse.ULB: to Timothy, beloved child: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
verse.residue: to , : Grace, , and from the and our .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:3
verse.Greek: Χάριν ἔχω τῷ Θεῷ ᾧ λατρεύω ἀπὸ προγόνων ἐν καθαρᾷ συνειδήσει ὡς ἀδιάλειπτον ἔχω τὴν περὶ σοῦ μνείαν ἐν ταῖς δεήσεσίν μου νυκτὸς καὶ ἡμέρας
verse.ULB: I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers, with a clean conscience, as I constantly remember you in my prayers night and day.
verse.residue: I thank , whom I from my , with a , as I constantly remember you in my night and .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:4
verse.Greek: ἐπιποθῶν σε ἰδεῖν μεμνημένος σου τῶν δακρύων ἵνα χαρᾶς πληρωθῶ
verse.ULB: As I remember your tears, I long to see you, that I may be filled with joy.
verse.residue: As I remember your tears, I long to see you, that I may be filled with .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:5
verse.Greek: ὑπόμνησιν λαβὼν τῆς ἐν σοὶ ἀνυποκρίτου πίστεως ἥτις ἐνῴκησεν πρῶτον ἐν τῇ μάμμῃ σου Λωΐδι καὶ τῇ μητρί σου Εὐνίκῃ πέπεισμαι δὲ ὅτι καὶ ἐν σοί
verse.ULB: I have been reminded of your genuine faith, which lived first in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice, and I am convinced that it lives in you also.
verse.residue: I have been of your genuine , which lived first in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice, and I am that it lives in you also.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:6
verse.Greek: Δι᾽ ἣν αἰτίαν ἀναμιμνῄσκω σε ἀναζωπυρεῖν τὸ χάρισμα τοῦ Θεοῦ ὅ ἐστιν ἐν σοὶ διὰ τῆς ἐπιθέσεως τῶν χειρῶν μου
verse.ULB: This is the reason I am reminding you to rekindle the gift of God which is in you through the laying on of my hands.
verse.residue: This is the reason I am reminding you to rekindle the of which is in you through the laying on of my .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:7
verse.Greek: οὐ γὰρ ἔδωκεν ἡμῖν ὁ Θεὸς πνεῦμα δειλίας ἀλλὰ δυνάμεως καὶ ἀγάπης καὶ σωφρονισμοῦ
verse.ULB: For God did not give us a spirit of fear, but of power and love and discipline.
verse.residue: For did not give us a of , but of and and .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:8
verse.Greek: Μὴ οὖν ἐπαισχυνθῇς τὸ μαρτύριον τοῦ Κυρίου ἡμῶν μηδὲ ἐμὲ τὸν δέσμιον αὐτοῦ ἀλλὰ συνκακοπάθησον τῷ εὐαγγελίῳ κατὰ δύναμιν Θεοῦ
verse.ULB: So do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord, nor of me, Paul, his prisoner. Instead, share in suffering for the gospel according to the power of God,
verse.residue: So do not be of the about our , nor of me, Paul, his . Instead, share in for the according to the of ,

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:9
verse.Greek: τοῦ σώσαντος ἡμᾶς καὶ καλέσαντος κλήσει ἁγίᾳ οὐ κατὰ τὰ ἔργα ἡμῶν ἀλλὰ κατὰ ἰδίαν πρόθεσιν καὶ χάριν τὴν δοθεῖσαν ἡμῖν ἐν Χριστῷ Ἰησοῦ πρὸ χρόνων αἰωνίων
verse.ULB: who saved us and called us with a holy calling. He did this, not according to our works, but according to his own plan and grace, which he gave us in Christ Jesus before times ever began.
verse.residue: who us and us with a . He did this, not according to our , but according to his own plan and , which he gave us before began.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:10
verse.Greek: φανερωθεῖσαν δὲ νῦν διὰ τῆς ἐπιφανείας τοῦ Σωτῆρος ἡμῶν Χριστοῦ Ἰησοῦ καταργήσαντος μὲν τὸν θάνατον φωτίσαντος δὲ ζωὴν καὶ ἀφθαρσίαν διὰ τοῦ εὐαγγελίου
verse.ULB: But now God's salvation has been revealed by the appearing of our Savior Christ Jesus, who put an end to death and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel.
verse.residue: But now God's salvation has been by the appearing of our , who put an end to and brought and immortality to light through the .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:11

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:12
verse.Greek: Δι᾽ ἣν αἰτίαν καὶ ταῦτα πάσχω ἀλλ᾽ οὐκ ἐπαισχύνομαι οἶδα γὰρ ᾧ πεπίστευκα καὶ πέπεισμαι ὅτι δυνατός ἐστιν τὴν παραθήκην μου φυλάξαι εἰς ἐκείνην τὴν ἡμέραν
verse.ULB: For this cause I also suffer these things. But I am not ashamed, for I know him whom I have believed. I am convinced that he is able to keep that which I have entrusted to him until that day.
verse.residue: For this cause I also these things. But I am not , for I him whom I have believed. I am that he to that which I have to him until .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:13
verse.Greek: Ὑποτύπωσιν ἔχε ὑγιαινόντων λόγων ὧν παρ᾽ ἐμοῦ ἤκουσας ἐν πίστει καὶ ἀγάπῃ τῇ ἐν Χριστῷ Ἰησοῦ
verse.ULB: Keep the example of the truthful words that you heard from me, with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.
verse.residue: Keep the example of the that you from me, with the and that are .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:14
verse.Greek: τὴν καλὴν παραθήκην φύλαξον διὰ Πνεύματος Ἁγίου τοῦ ἐνοικοῦντος ἐν ἡμῖν
verse.ULB: The good thing that God committed to you, guard it through the Holy Spirit, who lives in us.
verse.residue: The thing that God committed to you, guard it through the , who lives in us.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:15
verse.Greek: Οἶδας τοῦτο ὅτι ἀπεστράφησάν με πάντες οἱ ἐν τῇ Ἀσίᾳ ὧν ἐστιν Φύγελος καὶ Ἑρμογένης
verse.ULB: You know this, that all who live in Asia turned away from me. In this group are Phygelus and Hermogenes.
verse.residue: You this, that all who live in ı from me. In this group are Phygelus and Hermogenes.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:16
verse.Greek: Δῴη ἔλεος ὁ Κύριος τῷ Ὀνησιφόρου οἴκῳ ὅτι πολλάκις με ἀνέψυξεν καὶ τὴν ἅλυσίν μου οὐκ ἐπαισχύνθη
verse.ULB: May the Lord grant mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chain.
verse.residue: May the grant to the of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me and was not of my .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:17
verse.Greek: ἀλλὰ γενόμενος ἐν Ῥώμῃ σπουδαίως ἐζήτησέν με καὶ εὗρεν
verse.ULB: Instead, when he was in Rome, he sought me diligently, and he found me.
verse.residue: Instead, when he was in , he me diligently, and he found me.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 1:18
verse.Greek: Δῴη αὐτῷ ὁ Κύριος εὑρεῖν ἔλεος παρὰ Κυρίου ἐν ἐκείνῃ τῇ ἡμέρᾳ καὶ ὅσα ἐν Ἐφέσῳ διηκόνησεν βέλτιον σὺ γινώσκεις
verse.ULB: May the Lord grant to him to find mercy from him on that day. All the ways he served me in Ephesus, you know very well.
verse.residue: May the grant to him to find from him on . All the ways he me in , you very well.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:1
verse.Greek: Σὺ οὖν τέκνον μου ἐνδυναμοῦ ἐν τῇ χάριτι τῇ ἐν Χριστῷ Ἰησοῦ
verse.ULB: You therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verse.residue: You therefore, my , be in the that is .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:2
verse.Greek: καὶ ἃ ἤκουσας παρ᾽ ἐμοῦ διὰ πολλῶν μαρτύρων ταῦτα παράθου πιστοῖς ἀνθρώποις οἵτινες ἱκανοὶ ἔσονται καὶ ἑτέρους διδάξαι

verse.residue: The things you from me among many , entrust them to who will be able to others also.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:3
verse.Greek: Συνκακοπάθησον ὡς καλὸς στρατιώτης Χριστοῦ Ἰησοῦ
verse.ULB: Suffer hardship with me as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
verse.residue: Suffer hardship with me as a of .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:4
verse.Greek: οὐδεὶς στρατευόμενος ἐμπλέκεται ταῖς τοῦ βίου πραγματείαις ἵνα τῷ στρατολογήσαντι ἀρέσῃ
verse.ULB: No soldier serves while entangled in the affairs of this life, so that he may please his superior officer.
verse.residue: No serves while entangled in the affairs of this , so that he may please his superior officer.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:5
verse.Greek: ἐὰν δὲ καὶ ἀθλῇ τις οὐ στεφανοῦται ἐὰν μὴ νομίμως ἀθλήσῃ
verse.ULB: Also, if someone competes as an athlete, he is not crowned unless he competes by the rules.
verse.residue: Also, if someone competes as an athlete, he is not unless he competes by the .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:6

verse.ULB: It is necessary that the hard-working farmer receive his share of the crops first.
verse.residue: It is necessary that the farmer his share of the first.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:7
verse.Greek: νόει ὃ λέγω δώσει γάρ σοι ὁ Κύριος σύνεσιν ἐν πᾶσιν

verse.residue: Think about what I am saying, for the will give you in everything.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:8

verse.Greek: Σπούδασον σεαυτὸν δόκιμον παραστῆσαι τῷ Θεῷ ἐργάτην ἀνεπαίσχυντον ὀρθοτομοῦντα τὸν λόγον τῆς ἀληθείας

verse.residue: Avoid and empty talk, which leads to more and more .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:20
verse.Greek: Ἐν μεγάλῃ δὲ οἰκίᾳ οὐκ ἔστιν μόνον σκεύη χρυσᾶ καὶ ἀργυρᾶ ἀλλὰ καὶ ξύλινα καὶ ὀστράκινα καὶ ἃ μὲν εἰς τιμὴν ἃ δὲ εἰς ἀτιμίαν

verse.residue: In a wealthy there are not only containers of and . There are also containers of wood and clay. Some of these are for use, and some for .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:21

verse.residue: If someone cleans himself from dishonorable use, he is an container. He is , useful to the Master, and prepared for every .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 2:22
verse.Greek: Τὰς δὲ νεωτερικὰς ἐπιθυμίας φεῦγε δίωκε δὲ δικαιοσύνην πίστιν ἀγάπην εἰρήνην μετὰ τῶν ἐπικαλουμένων τὸν Κύριον ἐκ καθαρᾶς καρδίας

verse.ULB: But know this: In the last days there will be difficult times.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:2
verse.Greek: ἔσονται γὰρ οἱ ἄνθρωποι φίλαυτοι φιλάργυροι ἀλαζόνες ὑπερήφανοι βλάσφημοι γονεῦσιν ἀπειθεῖς ἀχάριστοι ἀνόσιοι

verse.residue: For people will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, , , , to parents, ungrateful, and .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:3
verse.Greek: ἄστοργοι ἄσπονδοι διάβολοι ἀκρατεῖς ἀνήμεροι ἀφιλάγαθοι
verse.ULB: They will be without natural affection, unable to reconcile, slanderers, without self-control, violent, not lovers of good.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:4
verse.Greek: προδόται προπετεῖς τετυφωμένοι φιλήδονοι μᾶλλον ἢ φιλόθεοι
verse.ULB: They will be betrayers, reckless, prideful, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:5
verse.Greek: ἔχοντες μόρφωσιν εὐσεβείας τὴν δὲ δύναμιν αὐτῆς ἠρνημένοι καὶ τούτους ἀποτρέπου
verse.ULB: They will have a shape of godliness, but they will deny its power. Turn away from these people.
verse.residue: They will have a shape of , but they will its . Turn away from these people.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:6
verse.Greek: Ἐκ τούτων γάρ εἰσιν οἱ ἐνδύνοντες εἰς τὰς οἰκίας καὶ αἰχμαλωτίζοντες γυναικάρια σεσωρευμένα ἁμαρτίαις ἀγόμενα ἐπιθυμίαις ποικίλαις

verse.residue: For some of them are men who enter into and foolish women. These are women who are loaded up with and are led away by various .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:7
verse.Greek: πάντοτε μανθάνοντα καὶ μηδέποτε εἰς ἐπίγνωσιν ἀληθείας ἐλθεῖν δυνάμενα
verse.ULB: These women are always learning, but they are never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
verse.residue: These women always learning, but they are never to come to the of the .

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:8
verse.Greek: ὃν τρόπον δὲ Ἰάννης καὶ Ἰαμβρῆς ἀντέστησαν Μωϋσεῖ οὕτως καὶ οὗτοι ἀνθίστανται τῇ ἀληθείᾳ ἄνθρωποι κατεφθαρμένοι τὸν νοῦν ἀδόκιμοι περὶ τὴν πίστιν
verse.ULB: In the same way that Jannes and Jambres stood against Moses, these false teachers also stand against the truth. They are men corrupt in mind, and with regard to the faith they are rejected.
verse.residue: In the same way that Jannes and Jambres stood against , these false teachers also stand against the . They are men in , and with regard to the they are rejected.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:9
verse.Greek: ἀλλ᾽ οὐ προκόψουσιν ἐπὶ πλεῖον ἡ γὰρ ἄνοια αὐτῶν ἔκδηλος ἔσται πᾶσιν ὡς καὶ ἡ ἐκείνων ἐγένετο
verse.ULB: But they will not advance very far. For their foolishness will be obvious to all, just like that of those men.
verse.residue: But they will not advance very far. For their will be obvious to all, just like that of those men.

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:10
verse.Greek: Σὺ δὲ παρηκολούθησάς μου τῇ διδασκαλίᾳ τῇ ἀγωγῇ τῇ προθέσει τῇ πίστει τῇ μακροθυμίᾳ τῇ ἀγάπῃ τῇ ὑπομονῇ
verse.ULB: But as for you, you have followed my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, longsuffering, love, patience,
verse.residue: But as for you, you have followed my , conduct, purpose, , longsuffering, , ,

verse.name: 2 Timothy 3:11

verse.name: 2 Timothy 4:16
verse.Greek: Ἐν τῇ πρώτῃ μου ἀπολογίᾳ οὐδείς μοι παρεγένετο ἀλλὰ πάντες με ἐγκατέλιπον μὴ αὐτοῖς λογισθείη

verse.name: 2 Timothy 4:17
